summary: Describes the selection, configuration, and routing of filesystem backends for deep agents, including virtual filesystems and policy hooks.
Interactive CLI for building agents with persistent memory, supporting file operations, shell commands, web search, HTTP requests, task planning, memory storage, and human approval.
Learn to customize deep agents for specific tasks using system prompts, tools, and subagents.
Describes the core components and capabilities of the agent harness, including file system access, task delegation, and conversation history management.
Configure human approval for sensitive operations using LangGraph's interrupt capabilities, covering setup, decision types, and handling multiple tool calls.
Explains extending deep agents with long-term memory using CompositeBackend for hybrid storage across threads.
Introduces a modular middleware architecture for deep agents, supporting planning, filesystem operations, and subagent capabilities.
Overview of building complex task agents using planning, subagents, and file system capabilities.
Guide to quickly building a research deep agent with planning, file system tools, and subagents.
Explains the use, configuration, best practices, and troubleshooting of subagents for task delegation and context management.
